Thankyou everyone. I’m a bit scared to ask to switch HV as it may trigger a ‘not engaging with services’ so I’ll smile and nod and deal. 

We’re enjoying being a family of 3- less enjoy at 2am more endure. 

I could write a book about the misogyny inherent with having a baby
Feel free to have a go at me; but I warn you I have an 8 week old, I’m sleep deprived and I will not be taking any crap.
We’re all just saying the things we need to say to get them off our case.

She’s now decided that I’m not the worlds worst mother. Meanwhile I and Miran have asked around. Not a single person I know has anything positive to say about this profession who seem to aim destroy mothers at an incredibly vulnerable time.

Next time, I have backup of my mother. 

The judgement continues, she knows what job my husband does, absolutely no clue what I do for a living. 

Astonished that I’m going back full time.
She went on and on, pushing every button she could think of before she broke me, tears seemed to be her aim, she left with the threat to return.

She tells me only I or my husband can look after the baby. He’s at work, I’m on about 3 hours sleep. 

And no one else can help…..

She then proceeds to pick at me over my decision to return to work ‘who will look after the baby?’ 
‘His dad’

Cue more judgement.

Since this woman does not know what I do she cannot know that I am probably fairly well qualified to judge whether baby has any sort of tongue tie. Let alone the bullshit of a posterior tie! The only way I can see to divide this as described would be under GA.

The judgement about not breastfeeding is thick in the air then she tells me my baby has a posterior tongue tie. To clarify I did not jump down her throat, I asked her to explain what precisely she thinks she has seen. 

She then recants.
Enter the health vistor. This woman is responsible for what can only be described as bullying. I am not a weak person but she is a witch.

I tried breastfeeding, I will gladly talk about why I am so much happier formula feeding. 

It is the best decision I have ever made.

I am so fed up of reading this crap, at what point did we decide that women were going to be thought lesser than men?

Having a child is one of the most dangerous things a woman does, the statistics for morbidity and mortality are startling and yet we seem to accept it as an acceptable price to pay for the blessing of a child.
Women all around the world are being forced to give birth and then finding that actually no one cares about them or their child. (Thinking of the US mainly but applies all over the world)
Men are ‘babysitting’ if they look after their own children. We fetishise a man who’s looking after a baby, ask any man who’s been to a baby group what the response is.

Why was I told ‘you’ll have to think carefully about a family if you want to do oncology’ ? 
Why am I presumed that i will be the default parent? Children have 2 parents for a reason.

Childcare costs are so astronomical that it’s uneconomic for women to return to work. 
When they do return to work they’re sidelined, accused of ‘baby-brain’ or not being focused on work.

We need not think we have it right in the UK either, chatting to someone who’s just told work she’s going part time post maternity leave- the response was incredibly negative. 

Part time in this instance probably means 35hrs a week.

The state of the world makes me so angry. Rather than trying to fix the underlying inequalities we’re just forcing women to do things. Again. 

More countries ‘trying to coerce women to have more children’, report finds | The Independent https://t.co/WgQNGHQ0C8

@YavorRM @ldndoc @OrthopodReg @londonsdrcosmo @ASiTofficial @bota_uk Put it this way, when you have a post radiotherapy head and neck patient who you can’t get a tube into, would you (and the patient) prefer I’d done 50 trachys or 1 decent first author paper??

@YavorRM @ldndoc @OrthopodReg @londonsdrcosmo @ASiTofficial @bota_uk @RCSnews @RCSEd @rcpsglasgow @JCST_Surgery And therefore we neglect the actual operating in favour of producing academic work. 

I want my surgeon to be good, not spend their days doing a systematic review into serum rhubarb.

@YavorRM @ldndoc @OrthopodReg @londonsdrcosmo @ASiTofficial @bota_uk @RCSnews @RCSEd @rcpsglasgow @JCST_Surgery And therein lies the problem, forcing trainees to publish will inevitably increase the number of publications thereby diluting the overall pool of research and meaning that if you’re looking for evidence you have to really dig for the good stuff.

@YavorRM @ldndoc @OrthopodReg @londonsdrcosmo @ASiTofficial @bota_uk @RCSnews @RCSEd @rcpsglasgow @JCST_Surgery Not to mention the extra stress on trainers who may have multiple other calls on their time. 

You can be an exceptional surgeon and not spend every waking minute thinking about surgery.

@YavorRM @ldndoc @OrthopodReg @londonsdrcosmo @ASiTofficial @bota_uk @RCSnews @RCSEd @rcpsglasgow @JCST_Surgery Have it in the curriculum by all means but do not mandate it.
